subComponents.description:
Boundary layer turbulence scheme of the mixed layer is based on the EDMF scheme of Siebesma, Soares and Teixeira (2007) and Koehler (2005). The diffusion part is based on the K-profile closure of Troen and Mahrt (1986) while the non-local convective transport is based on a mass-flux formulation. The surface fluxes in the surface layer are expressed in terms of gradients using Monin-Obukhov similarity theory. 
Deep convection has an entrainment that depends on the environmental relative humidity (Bechtold et al, 2008)
Cloud and large-scale precipitation processes are described by prognostic equations for cloud liquid water/ice and cloud fraction and diagnostic relations for precipitation (Tiedtke, 1993).

values: Detrainment, generation by cooling,advection,sedimentation of ice, warm and mixed phase precipitation generation
IR brightness and visible optical depth

subComponents.description: A semi-langrangian advection scheme is used for momentum, temperature and moisture.
Gravity wave drag and blocked flow drag due to sub-gridscale orography are parameterised, Baines and Palmer (1990), Lott and Miller (1997)

values: Solar forcing data from SPARC workinggroup on solar variability
Orbital parameters are updated every timestep
Prescribed volcanic aerosols from GISS for 1850-2010

subComponents.description: SnowAlbedo is a Function of Snow age and snow melt

values: Transpiration, evaporation, soil heat flux, shortwave reflection, longwave emission,sentible heat exchange

subComponents.description: SchemMethod, SnowCoverFraction: Ground snow fraction for 2 snow tiles )low veg and high veg.

values: Seperate snow tiles in general surface scheme structure.
Snowcoverfraction:Grand snow fraction for 2 snow tiles(low and high veg.)

subComponents.description: Soil MoistureFreezing/Permafrost: Diagnostic detection of frozen ground within soil profile (up to 2.89m).

values: Diagnostic ice fraction, dependent on temperature
Clay/sand/silt proportion varying with soil type
6 soil types descerned, derived from FAO10' database (coarese, medium, medium fine, fine, very fine, organic)
Fixed broadband albedo derived from MODIS varying spatially and monthly
Light, vapour pressure deficit, soil water

subComponents.longName: Hydrological extension of the Tiled ECMWF Surface SCheme for Exchnage processes over Land

properties.description:
Genealogy: ECMWF development chain (Viterbo&Beljaars95, TESSEL,HTESSEL ).
Coupling with atmosphere: implicit (Surface skin temperature is solved with atmospheric fluxes during every time step. Seperate caculation of surface flux es per tile, averaged to an effective surface skin temperature before calculating grid box mean fluxes. Three iterations to solve flux/gradient relationship.)

values: Energy and Water balance closure, Monin/Obukhov similarity, Diffusion equation in soil, no horizontal exchange between grid boxes
4000 polewards of 20N/S decrease to 2000 N/m2/s at equator

subComponents.longName: Nucleus for European Modelling of the Ocean

values: Into grid boxes adjacent to river month; only surface (as if rain)
Depending on snow/ice, clear/overcast sky, snow melting/freezing
Ice formed with from prescribed thickness
One layer of snow but the snow-ice system consists of two layers.
Multi-layer on a regular vertical grid
Sea-ice[thickness, concentration, velocity, temperature, heat content], snow thickness, snow temperature.
